text: Hey <@U7SL518D6> Can I still use `hs_call_recording_url` to only play the recording in the URL still? even post September 2024?

or do I need to build a API of my own to serve a authenticated recording url in response whenever a user looks up an engagement activity. My use case is only to create a call engagement with a recording url to be played in the frontend, not looking to transcribe the audio.

Hi Team, I came across this <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/new-recording-transcripts-api-replaces-hs_call_recording_url-for-call-engagements>. does that me when we read the batch of call engagements via the API, we no longer see the Twilio links in hs_call_recording_url too?

Hello all,

I’m trying to a batch read for companies where i don’t have access to the internal HubSpot id (but i do have the `domain` value). It looks like it should be possible to do this (i.e. do a batch read based on a unique property other than the id, such as domain). <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/companies>

But whenever i try to call the interface without the id, like so:

api_client.crm.companies.batch_api.read(batch_read_input_simple_public_object_id=BatchReadInputSimplePublicObjectId(id_property="domain", inputs=[{"domain":<domain_value>}]))

I get the error:

HTTP response body: {"status":"error","message":"Invalid input JSON on line 1, column 61. Some required fields were not set: [id]","correlationId":"13311a7b-2829-4f88-a587-452d8560ee28","category":"VALIDATION_ERROR"}

Can anyone help me understand how to do a batch read without the internal id (using another unique property) If this is possible?
Great tips - will check the endpoints tab from now one, thanks <@U01QVR44MEY>

Hey, I'm trying to get back information from the connected company & owner when I call `crm/v3/objects/deals/{ID}`. Is this possible or do I need to make 2 more calls to get the missing information?
You would need to use a couple more calls to get that info, or you could use the graphql api: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/query-HubSpot-data-using-graphql>
The GraphQL api looks like the perfect solution for my problem. Thanks for the help!
of course
let me know if you run into any issues
create a list and use that as a parameter? supposing that you're looking at contacts or companies.

Hi all,
Yes the current Conversations API is good for the use cases Carter screenshotted from our dev docs. In 2024 HubSpot will start to release a separate API for anyone to add a channel to the Inbox (like SMS or Telegram or something else). No firm dates yet but look for private beta announcements some months from now.
Otherwise, the workarounds are not so fun, it's true.
Awesome, thanks for the info <@U04B32JHTUZ>!
For sure. It's been a long time coming. It's still coming, and this is the year I'll finally be able to start giving more details and working with the developer community on early release feedback.

Yes, you can use HubSpot custom objects Properties
here is the API ref:

Thanks!

Hey all, I'm struggling with a very peculiar issue:

1. When I create a contact I can populate the custom fields
2. Then when I try to create the same contact with slightly different details
3. The system recognises the contact and updates the fields instead of creating a new contact
4. But the custom fields don't update instead they go null
Can someone help me understand why the normal fields update but the custom fields don't?
Can you share your api requests?

I'm using this endpoint:
*POST* `/crm/v3/objects/contacts`

This is the JSON:
```{
  "properties": {
    "email": "{{email}}",
    "firstname": "{{name}}",
    "lastname": "{{surname}}",
    "phone": "{{phone}}",
    "company": "{{company}}",
    "message": "{{message}}",
    "website_source": "Contact Us Form",
    "website_forms": "CONTACT_FORM"
  }
}```
And then the second call?
This is it, I just want the custom fields to behave like the normal fields and update if the contact already exists
well are you telling HubSpot to create a new contact or update an existing one?
To update an existing one you have to give the contact id at the end of the request url
like <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts/123>
or the email: <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts/nerds@gmail.com?idProperty=email>
Ah that's a shame
Appreciate the help, going to try it quick and let you know

It is possible
Let me grab the docs for you

Hi, looking for a little help here… I’ve removed the API Key to share on here but I do include in the script. The code works, the issue is it’s not taking the Contact ID. It’s just grabbing so many instances of the first known Email engagement. And I understand I would need to add a Page and Offset options to get more data but why is it not grabbing the Email engagement from the Contact ID I’m using in the contactId value. Below is my code. Any help would be appreciated…

`const https = require('https');`

`const apiKey = 'I_Removed_For_Security_To_Show';`
`const contactId = '148773301';`

`// Function to make a GET request to the HubSpot API`
`function getHubSpotData(path, callback) {`
    `const options = {`
        `hostname: '<http://api.hubapi.com|api.hubapi.com>',`
        `path: path,`
        `method: 'GET',`
    `};`

    `const req = https.request(options, (res) => {`
        `let data = '';`
        `res.on('data', (chunk) => {`
            `data += chunk;`
        `});`
        `res.on('end', () => {`
            `callback(JSON.parse(data));`
        `});`
    `});`

    `req.on('error', (e) => {`
        `console.error(e);`
    `});`

    `req.end();`
`}`

`// Function to retrieve all email engagements`
`function getEmailEngagements() {`
    `const path = `/engagements/v1/engagements/paged?hapikey=${apiKey}`;`
    `getHubSpotData(path, (data) => {`
        `const emailEngagements = data.results.filter(engagement =>`
            `engagement.type === 'EMAIL' &&`
            `engagement.associations.contactIds.includes(contactId)`
        `);`
        `console.log(emailEngagements);`
    `});`
`}`

`getEmailEngagements();`
So this is kinda messed up because that api doesn't allow you to filter by associated contact id, also apikeys have been deprecated, so you'll want to use a private app token
I would suggest using the email search api and filter by the associated contact <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/email>
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search#search-through-associations>
Hey <@U01QVR44MEY> Your totally right. I was analyzing the code and realized it was wonky. Thanks for pointing me in the right direction!
of course man!
Thank you! Really helpful... Validated some things I suspected...I'm going to dig into this further. Thanks again!
